page.title: 16Bewl Bridge Reservoir
page.content: Bewl Bridge Reservoir, the largest piece of truly inland water between London and the South Coast, falls partly within this block and Ticehurst is one of the nearest residential areas to it. With a perimeter of 15 miles it provides facilities for walking and riding as well as many water sports and a wildlife reserve. Out of a survey of 25 ten and eleven year olds, only three made children use it frequently and twenty use less often than once a month. The main reasons for not going more often were because they are not allowed and have difficulty in getting there. When they do go there it is mainly to walk although 8 go fishing, 4 bird watching, 3 sail and 1 goes horse riding. When we asked what use their parents made of the resevoir this was very similar.
